channel.title: Is it possible?
channel.description:
Do you think like, i dont know how to explain this, lets say members have a higher priority of selling things than F2P
example:
One person puts 100 air runes to buy in the ge (f2p) at 10 gp each
Another person puts the same amount in for the same price to buy, but is P2P
The F2P person put in the offer an hour before the P2P player, but when someone sold 100 air runes at 10gp, the P2P player got it.
Do you think this is what jagex does? Like P2P players have a higher chance of buying or selling things than a f2p player?
Discuss

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Voidiskwl Voidiskwl
item.description:
@Voidiskwl wrote:

I don’t think so .

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

I believe it depends more on the world…

are both these players f2p and p2p on the same world when their transactions take place?

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:7, topic:384577”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=480340.msg3516564#msg3516564 date=1299035809]

It’s possible, but I doubt it. The grand exchange has a queue system that they use for orders, which is why it is advised if buying a large quantity of item to use multiple slots. If they did this, they would probably tell the players to increase the amount of people buying membership…

yeah, but they may not be telling us, i havent tested this or anything yet, nor do i know any item or price i can do this on, but you never know… Plus i would actually expect this from jagex, because they “LUVZ DER MONEH”.
[/quote]

I wouldn’t understand why they would have that feature without telling people. If they had this, wouldn’t you want to mention it to F2P players to try and persuade them even further to buy membership?[/quote]
yeah, that is a good point.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?

It’s possible, but I doubt it. The grand exchange has a queue system that they use for orders, which is why it is advised if buying a large quantity of item to use multiple slots. If they did this, they would probably tell the players to increase the amount of people buying membership…
[/quote]
yeah, but they may not be telling us, i havent tested this or anything yet, nor do i know any item or price i can do this on, but you never know… Plus i would actually expect this from jagex, because they “LUVZ DER MONEH”.[/quote]

I wouldn’t understand why they would have that feature without telling people. If they had this, wouldn’t you want to mention it to F2P players to try and persuade them even further to buy membership?

Read full topic
